episodeTitle: It All Started On That Day! Vivi Tells the Story of Her Adventure!
episodeTitleJapanese: 始まりはあの日！ビビが語る冒険譚
episodeTitleRomanized: Hajimaru wa ano hi! Bibi ga kataru bōkendan
description: Vivi must decide between joining the Straw Hat Pirates and fulfilling her duty to Alabasta. As the crew battles Marines at the harbor, Bon Kurei sacrifices himself to help them escape. Vivi delivers an emotional farewell speech, and the Straw Hats silently confirm their eternal friendship by raising their X-marked arms.

events.title: Nefertari Titi Appears in Flashback
events.description: Queen Nefertari Titi, Vivi's deceased mother, appears in flashback scenes as King Cobra reflects on how much Vivi resembles her. The flashback shows Titi during her time as queen of Alabasta.
events.significance: First visual appearance of Vivi's mother, providing backstory to the Nefertari royal family and deepening the emotional weight of Vivi's decision to stay with her country.

events.title: Maidy's Debut
events.description: Maidy, a servant of the Nefertari Family working as a lady's maid, appears helping prepare Vivi for her coming-of-age ceremony at Alubarna Palace.
events.significance: Minor character introduction establishing the palace staff and the preparations for Vivi's important ceremony.

events.title: Igaram's Dream - Vivi as Pirate Queen
events.description: Igaram has a nightmare where Vivi declares she wants to become the Pirate Queen instead of fulfilling her royal duties. He wakes up in distress and rushes to check on her, showing his deep concern about her decision.
events.significance: Reveals Igaram's anxiety about Vivi potentially choosing to leave with the pirates, establishing the tension around her upcoming decision.

events.title: Marine Battle at Harbor Begins
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates engage in battle with Marine forces led by Captain Hina at the harbor. The Marines attempt to sink the Going Merry while the crew fights to protect their ship and wait for Vivi.
events.significance: Sets up the time pressure for Vivi's decision and demonstrates the consequences of the crew's actions in Alabasta as they face Marine pursuit.

events.title: Hina Uses Ori Ori no Mi Against the Straw Hats
events.description: Captain Hina demonstrates her Ori Ori no Mi (Cage-Cage Fruit) powers, creating iron restraints to damage the Going Merry's hull. The crew faces eight Marine vessels while heavily outnumbered.
events.significance: First direct combat use of Hina's Devil Fruit powers against the Straw Hats, establishing her as a formidable Marine officer and increasing the danger of the situation.

quotes.text: Hina is angry. You pirates won't escape.
quotes.speaker: Hina
quotes.context: Hina confronting the Straw Hats with her Devil Fruit powers

events.title: Bon Kurei Impersonates Luffy as Decoy
events.description: Mr. 2 Bentham uses his Mane Mane no Mi powers to impersonate Luffy, creating confusion about which ship carries the real Straw Hats. He orchestrates a clever disguise plan with his crew to act as decoys.
events.significance: Demonstrates Bon Kurei's transformation from antagonist to ally, showcasing his loyalty and selflessness. This sacrifice enables the Straw Hats' escape and reunion with Vivi.

events.title: Bon Kurei's Sacrifice for the Straw Hats
events.description: Bon Kurei and his crew engage Hina's Marine forces directly, sacrificing their own safety to allow the Going Merry to escape. The Straw Hats shed tears, vowing never to forget his sacrifice.
events.significance: Cements Bon Kurei's redemption arc and establishes one of the series' most powerful themes: the bonds of friendship transcending former allegiances. His selfless act saves the crew.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's tearful promise to Bon Kurei as they escape

events.title: Igaram Impersonates Vivi at Ceremony
events.description: Igaram disguises himself as Vivi to stand in at the official coming-of-age ceremony in Alubarna, buying Vivi time to meet the Straw Hats. The crowd eventually realizes the deception.
events.significance: Shows Igaram's loyalty and willingness to help Vivi say goodbye to her friends, even if it means participating in a deception. Allows Vivi to make her farewell.

events.title: Vivi's Speech About Her Adventures
events.description: Using a handheld speaker from the Eastern Port, Vivi delivers a metaphorical speech describing her journey with the Straw Hats. She speaks of a ship that 'never lost its way in the darkness and crossed over monstrous waves as if they were dancing.'
events.significance: Vivi publicly acknowledges (in coded language) her adventures while maintaining her commitment to Alabasta. The speech serves as both a tribute to the Straw Hats and a message to her people.

quotes.text: This ship never lost its way in the darkness and crossed over monstrous waves as if they were dancing.
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi's metaphorical description of the Straw Hats during her speech

events.title: Vivi Arrives to Say Goodbye
events.description: Vivi reaches the harbor where the Straw Hat crew is waiting as promised. She tells them she has come to say goodbye and that she will be staying in Alabasta to fulfill her duties as princess.
events.significance: The culmination of Vivi's character arc - choosing duty to her country over adventure. One of the most emotionally powerful moments in the series, showing her growth and resolve.

quotes.text: I came to say goodbye. I will be staying behind.
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi's tearful announcement to the crew

events.title: Vivi Asks About Their Friendship
events.description: Vivi tearfully asks the crew: 'If we ever meet again, would you still call me your friend?' She seeks confirmation that despite her choice to stay, their bond remains unbroken.
events.significance: Sets up one of the most iconic moments in One Piece. Vivi's question reveals her deepest fear - that leaving the crew means losing their friendship forever.

quotes.text: If we ever meet again, would you still call me your friend?
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi's emotional question to the Straw Hats

events.title: The X Mark Farewell - Silent Confirmation of Friendship
events.description: When Luffy attempts to answer Vivi verbally, Nami stops him, explaining that the Marines would brand Vivi a criminal. Instead, the entire Straw Hat crew silently raises their left arms, displaying the X marks they drew to counter Mr. 2's abilities. Vivi and Karoo respond by raising their own marked arms, confirming their eternal bond without words.
events.significance: One of the most iconic and emotionally powerful scenes in all of One Piece. The silent farewell demonstrates that true friendship transcends words and physical presence. The X marks, originally a practical countermeasure, become a symbol of eternal friendship. This scene is frequently cited as one of fans' favorite moments in the series.

quotes.text: Luffy! If you respond, they'll brand her a criminal. The Marines have seen Vivi!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami preventing Luffy from verbally confirming their friendship

events.title: Straw Hats Depart Alabasta
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates sail away from Alabasta on the Going Merry, carrying the memory of Vivi and their X-marked bond. Vivi remains at the shore, watching them leave.
events.significance: Marks the official end of the Arabasta Arc and Vivi's time traveling with the crew. The departure is bittersweet - a victory tainted by the loss of a beloved companion.

themes.description: Vivi faces the heart-wrenching choice between pursuing her dream of adventure with the Straw Hats and fulfilling her responsibility to Alabasta. She chooses duty, demonstrating mature selflessness.
themes.symbolism: The X marks represent a compromise - Vivi can't physically be with the crew, but their bond remains eternal through this symbol.

themes.description: The silent farewell scene demonstrates that true friendship doesn't require verbal confirmation. The X mark gesture communicates everything without risking Vivi's safety.
themes.symbolism: The X marks, originally drawn to counter Mr. 2's transformation ability, transform into a permanent symbol of unbreakable friendship.

themes.description: Both Bon Kurei and Vivi make significant sacrifices this episode. Bon Kurei risks capture to save the crew, while Vivi sacrifices adventure for her people.
themes.symbolism: The parallel sacrifices show that heroism comes in many forms - both action and restraint can be equally brave.

characterSpotlights.role: Central focus - makes her final decision
characterSpotlights.development: Vivi demonstrates incredible maturity by choosing her duty to Alabasta over her personal desire for adventure. Her tearful farewell and question about friendship show her deep love for the crew.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some emotional moments, particularly the farewell scene, with additional reaction shots and pacing.
Hina's epithet is translated as 'Black Cage Hina' in the anime versus 'Black Jail Hina' in some manga translations.

trivia.fact: This episode achieved a TV rating of 12.6% in Japan, ranking 5th for its timeslot.
The X mark farewell scene is consistently ranked as one of the most emotional and beloved moments in One Piece by fans worldwide.
The farewell scene was later reanimated in the 4th video of the 'WE ARE ONE' collection, a project commemorating One Piece's 100th manga volume and 1000th anime episode.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the end of Vivi's regular traveling with the Straw Hats, though she is still considered an honorary crew member.
